questions.question: One of the claimed benefits of having clear objectives is that

choices.answer: all customers know what the business is trying to achieve
the managers have a sense of direction when taking decisions
the business will always make a profit
there will be no arguments between managers and workers

questions.question: Which one of the following isn't likely to be a common business objective?

choices.answer: To make profit
To provide a service to the community
To pay as much tax as possible
To increase market share

questions.question: A business might have growth as one of its objectives because

choices.answer: they will be able to benefit from diseconomies of scale
they would be more likely to increase market share
the shareholders always prefer growth to increased profits
all businesses have to grow in order to survive

questions.question: Most businesses are likely to put survival as their main objective when

choices.answer: the competition is  becoming weaker
the economy is becoming weaker
the government plans to increase grants to firms
consumers are increasing their demand for products

questions.question: Which one of the following statements about stakeholder groups is accurate?

choices.answer: Stakeholders are people who are not interested in business
Stakeholder groups have direct interest in firms  decisions
Shareholders of a ltd company are not a stakeholder group

questions.question: Social enterprises are likely to have which combination of objectives?

choices.answer: Maximum returns for owners and increased market share
Community service, profits and protection of the environment
Survival and an increased share price
Increased profits for owners and protection of the community

questions.question: Which of the following stakeholders is most likely to be in favor of a new shopping center?

choices.answer: Owners of an existing town centre shop
Families with small children
Environmental groups who want less car use
Trade Unions who would like the creation of new jobs

questions.question: Which  of the following stakeholder groups is most likely to be against a new shopping center?

choices.answer: Central government
Suppliers of goods to the retail industry
Shoppers
A local primary school with a 500 student population

questions.question: How can a  conflict between stakeholder groups about a new shopping center be reduced?

choices.answer: New shops pay taxes to pay for building a new leisure park
The owners of new shops employ workers from other towns
The shoppers are allowed free parking in the new centre

questions.question: What is the most likely objective of a newly formed business enterprise?

choices.answer: Survival
Maximum profit
Rapid growth
Providing a service to the community.
